t: Isaiah 43
Restoration of Israel

Now*pn this is what the Lord*s says — the*ln one who created you, Jacob, and*ln the one who formed you, Israel— “Do*ln not fear, for I have redeemed you; I*ln have called you by your name; you are mine.

When*ln you pass through the waters, I*ln will be with you, and*ln the rivers will not overwhelm you. When*ln you walk through the fire, you*ln will not be scorched, and*ln the flame will not burn you.
For*ln I am the Lord*s your God, the*ln Holy One of Israel, and your Savior. I*ln have given Egypt as a ransom for you, Cush*ln and Seba in your place.
Because*ln you are precious in my sight and*ln honored, and I love you, I*ln will give people in exchange for you and*ln nations instead of your life.
Do*ln not fear, for I am with you; I*ln will bring your descendants from the east, and*ln gather you from the west.
I*ln will say to the north, ‘Give them up!’ and*ln to the south, ‘Do not hold them back!’ Bring*ln my sons from far away, and*ln my daughters from the ends of the earth—
everyone*ln who bears my name and*ln is created for my glory. I*ln have formed them; indeed, I have made them.”
Bring*pn out a people who are blind, yet have eyes, and*ln are deaf, yet have ears.

All*ln the nations are gathered together, and*ln the peoples are assembled. Who*ln among them can declare this, and*ln tell us the former things? Let*ln them present their witnesses to*ln vindicate themselves, so*ln that people may hear and say, “It is true.”

“You*ln are my witnesses”— this*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration — “and*pn my servant whom I have chosen, so*ln that you may know and believe me and*ln understand that I am he. No*ln god was formed before me, and*ln there will be none after me.
I — I*ln am the Lord.*s Besides*ln me, there is no Savior.
I*ln alone declared, saved, and proclaimed — and*ln not some foreign god among you. So*ln you are my witnesses” — this*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration — “and*pn I am God.
Also,*ln from today on I am he alone, and*ln none can rescue from my power. I*ln act, and who can reverse it?”
God’s Deliverance of Rebellious Israel

This*p is what the Lord,*s your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel says: Because*pn of you, I will send an army to Babylon and*ln bring all of them as fugitives, even*ln the Chaldeans in the ships in which they rejoice.
I*ln am the Lord,*s your Holy One, the*ln Creator of Israel, your King.
This*pn is what the Lord*s says — who*ln makes a way in the sea, and*ln a path through raging water,
who*ln brings out the chariot and horse, the*ln army and the mighty one together (they*ln lie down, they do not rise again; they*ln are extinguished, put out like a wick ) —
“Do*ln not remember the past events; pay*ln no attention to things of old.
Look,*ln I am about to do something new; even*ln now it is coming. Do you not see it? Indeed,*ln I will make a way in the wilderness, rivers*ln in the desert.
Wild*ln animals — jackals*ln and ostriches — will honor me, because*ln I provide water in the wilderness, and*ln rivers in the desert, to*ln give drink to my chosen people.
The*ln people I formed for myself will*ln declare my praise.
“But,*pn Jacob, you have not called on me, because,*ln Israel, you have become weary of me.
You*ln have not brought me your sheep for burnt offerings or*ln honored me with your sacrifices. I*ln have not burdened you with offerings or*ln wearied you with incense.
You*ln have not bought me aromatic cane with silver, or*ln satisfied me with the fat of your sacrifices. But*ln you have burdened me with your sins; you*ln have wearied me with your iniquities.
“I*pn am the one, I sweep away your transgressions for*ln my own sake and*ln remember your sins no more.
Remind*ln me. Let’s argue the case together. Recount*ln the facts, so that you may be vindicated.
Your*ln first father sinned, and*ln your mediators have rebelled against me.
So*ln I defiled the officers of the sanctuary, and*ln set Jacob apart for destruction and*ln Israel for scorn.
